title: A 16GB file reinstall seems a bit excessive.
body: I've been trying to reinstall league for a few days now, and I've already tried all the options given to me via the staff, and those that I could think of. This file was faster than updating from the old client which took two days for a 1.2GB file. But, mostly I'm just curious if there was a proper download I could do for all of the files, rather than using the patcher as I barely have 80KB of download speed. Which equates to 3.4 days to download, if no one uses their laptops, as well if the client doesn't decide to go black screen during the middle of an installation. Possibly a torrent of the game even from a few month ago would be better, as it still wouldn't be near the 16GB download from a patcher that resets every time you have no internet, or black screens in the middle of downloading. Also, please don't post that Hextech thing, it doesn't work to begin with.

replies.body:
It can be a bit bothersome at times when you're trying to install from fresh, but you do need to let the download finish all in one go since we don't yet have a way to pause the download. You could possibly have some success with a torrent, but keep in mind there's a chance it could also have some malicious software attached as well. 

I've run into this same issue myself a few times with certain games, and the best method I've come across is to start the download when you have plenty of time and little interruptions, such as late at night.

Considering your servers are distributing the files through the client, wouldn't making a .torrent containing those same files - which the client would run a local check on afterwards anyway - be just as easy to distribute?

Only issue that I can see would be the unpacking. It's unbelievable how many people making the mistake of unpacking something at the wrong location - even when specifically told to "extract _here_ [X]".

Yes, but that's user error, and that itself can be fixed by actually reading things. But if it's the entire folder, it's just as easy to slap it where you want to install it, then making a shortcut of the client.

Aye, if they included an extractor, sure. Just point it to where you want the game installed, and job done.
Then the next one, for the next patch, would just need to read the registry setting of where it was previously extracted, and having that location then set as a default.

There aren't actually any problems here - certainly not any technical ones - only solutions. 
But the devs. would need to listen first.

_**Stands and applauds.**_

You sir, win. Why? Because of the simple fact you saw the easiest, most effective solution to the hardest problem. There aren't any technical problems, the solutions are very simple in nature, and would mitigate league's constant growing (file size) problem at least in the download department.

Though that is a good response, the trouble is the DL speed itself. Left running too long the client black screens, this takes about 28 hours to do that. I do appreciate the response though, but it might be some time before I can redownload league.

If you're on a laptop, and the client black screens, I don't think that's the client itself, but just a power saving feature on the laptop.
Try fiddle around with the power settings, disabling stuff like sleep mode on the screen, and set the HDD and PCI power setting to "0" (disables any turn-off timer), as that also interferes with the network connection.

_On a 640 Kbps connection, you're kinda asking for it._

Contact your ISP, upgrade your modem, replace your network-card. Many things may help.

Also, this game, at least prevously, has supported a peer-to-peer patch download connection.

"Left running too long the client black screens" Second, I'm on a Desktop, also I'd like to point out that if the game downloads for some time, about 28 hours. It auto black screens the client, thus forcing you to restart the client, which automatically resets the download back to 16GB, since the fucking thing doesn't save its own progress.

I'm tempted to re-initiate my Netlimiter to try to replicate this issue now...

A ~640 Kbps connection is truly prehistoric (considering a double-ISDN line was 128 Kbps), and really shouldn't affect the client directly.

And as for black-screens, just the client or otherwise, what I'm saying is that the monitor and PC sleep-mode and various other automatic power-saving BS can and _does_ affect certain software. Especially the network dependant ones.

It ain't the first time I've seen it. Wake the PC from sleep come the morning, and the DL stands at exactly the same state as I left it in, minus the ~3 hours it'd take before the sleep-mode kicks in. 
Then the DL would have to re-assign all its connections, and then try to continue, sometimes start over due to corrupt files thanks to the abrupt network cut because of the sleep mode or some such nonsense.

Shouldn't happen, but it had. Haven't seen it in years though. I still have since made sure to disable any such auto-shutdown nonsense from the Power Options. And I too use a desktop. Done the same on my laptop.

I never said anything about having power save options on. I always have those off, as for the comment, my ping is normally 20 in game, so staying connected during a match isn't an issue. But when it comes to downloading massive files that aren't torrents. That's when it irks me, there's a reason torrents beat traditional DL's, even through clients. It's impossible to lose your progress unless you reformat your PC.

Thing is, I'm paying $41.00 for my AT&T garbage DSL, and with the hidden cost of other ISP's with limited usage a month to add even more charges, not all of us can afford $100.00+ a month ISP, and my desktop isn't anywhere near my 2wire modem.

The problem, is the file size, nothing else, IF LoL had actually given people options for torrent downloads, such as 6 years ago when people were asking for it, reinstalling the game itself wouldn't be an issue at all. Because one last time, staying connected isn't the issue, it's the speed at which its downloading locked at 50-80KB's a second in the client. My own speed is 680KBPS, it's the client here. The client is fine, for shorter files, for a full reinstall of a game that keeps getting files added with nothing removed? A torrent would be better by far.

>I never said anything about having power save options on. 

I know, but they are on by default. Hence why I has been mentioning it as something worth checking.
As you already have checked - which I didn't know up until right now - the problem lies elsewhere. I'm just trying to find possible culprits that may somewhat alleviate the problem.

I just did a quick peek on the web (had to poke it a lil' bit), and unfortunately, it does not seem to exist a .torrent, nor the new client supporting peer-to-peer connections at this point.

Which isn't a bad suggestion mind you, I'm just saying, those things are a plague to me. (power save options) You're trying your best, and I can't fault you for that. To do so, would be hypocritical, and dickish. If Rito itself did bother to make this a torrent DL, it would be pretty simple to do, even with the excuses some people give, a five year old could make a torrent download that's far faster than the client patcher.

As one is only peer-to-peer, this the other one is a full powered torrent that allows for seeders. More seeders = faster download speed = far less reinstall/fresh reinstall issues. All of this, can be provided on the website itself. It's literally a simple matter of converting your folder to a torrent file, a copy preferably, and provide this in the downloads section of the main website. This would open up in any torrent program you have, and run/download the file. Yes, it would still be 16GB, but it would be downloaded through a proper torrent program.

I'm not the sharpest tool in the shed, but even 30 seconds of searching found this information out. Even the fabled "background files" which would still be saved to your god damn PC, wouldn't be an issue, and even if they were? Run a file check, and get the rest of the tiny amount of files you would need. But the thing is, the magical invisible files people say are only on Rito's end aren't a thing, you need all the files installed on your own PC in order to even play League, again, look at any other MMORPG and you'll see they provide torrent downloads.

As a note for the development staff themselves: https://torrentfreak.com/how-to-create-a-torrent/ This literally took me 30 seconds to find, and takes less than 5 minutes to do, I tested it myself.

Regarding .torrents, I actually called out the Red on that myself just now in this very thread.
I haven't tried making and sharing a .torrent myself, because my UL speed sucks (~110 KBps max). Only fanatically downloading them [[I am a collector](http://boards.eune.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/off-topic-en/fQOqgEgz-show-your-set-up?comment=0001)].

My websearch found several others who has also been requesting .torrents, and asking about DLing such a one from a 3rd party, but the "potential of maliscious software being included would be too much of a risk", was the official answer.

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/OffIeYbF-the-full-game-torrent
https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/tlBA5cyy-lol-713-full-game-torrent

Yes, which is why I suggested Rito do it themselves, from the website itself would provide the most "bang for the buck". Again, the easiest solution Rito could do is apparently too hard to do. My own upload speed is about 60KB's a second, which here comes to glory of torrents, it adds most UL speeds if you're a seeder, and I've downloaded files far faster than my actual download speed, even so much as 20MB a second. To be precise, if others become seeders, you can download files far faster than normal methods.
